page.title: 14TRANSPORT-THE DOCKS-EXPORT
page.content: An agreement between the{Port Of Tyne Authority and{Tynegrain}Ltd.resulted in a new grain terminal being built. The Authority installed fast ship- loading equipment and Tynegrain provided the 31 silos with a storage capacity of 26,000 tonnes.The dryers and conveyors can process and dry grain immediately upon harvesting and export 40,000 tonnes in 12 weeks. {Coal}no longer dominates the trade of The Tyne but it is still the largest single item in the trade of the port. A new Â£9m. coal handling plant opened in 1985 at{Tyne}Dock.The plant is fed by rail and discharges from trains on to a conveyor belt and ships can be loaded at the rate of 2,000 tonnes per hour. {Westoe Colliery}is connected to Harton Staithes where nearly 2m tonnes of coal and waste is shipped per annum.
